flag.description: Minimum length of molecules (kb) that are used in BNX sort
Minimum number of label sites per molecule to use.
Map rate at which noise parameters are calculated. Decreasing map rate may enable autoNoise to find usable noise parameters.
Expected rate of false positive (# of labels present in molecules but not in the reference per 100kb). **Value ignored when using autoNoise.
Expected rate of false negative (% of reference labels absent in the molecules). **Value ignored when using autoNoise.

Fixed stretch noise parameter in kb. Sf is also named as SiteSD. In combination with ScalingSD, SiteSD indicates the variance of distance between 2 labels in the molecules. **Value ignored when using autoNoise.
Scaled stretch noise parameter in root-kb. In combination with SiteSD, ScalingSD indicates the variance of distance between 2 labels in the molecules. **Value ignored when using autoNoise.
Quadratic stretch noise parameter. In combination with ScalingSD and SiteSD, RelativeSD indicates the variance of distance between 2 labels in the molecules. Value ignored when using autoNoise.

Pairwise comparison during initial assembly only outputs alignments with Pvalue below this threshold. Recommended maximum value = 3e-5/GenomeSize(Labels). GenomeSize in Labels = GenomeSize in Bases x Label Density
Pairwise comparison during extension and refinement only outputs alignments with Pvalue below this threshold. Recommended value is one order of magnitude smaller than Initial Assembly Pvalue.
Increase in variance due to misresolved labels at either end of interval.

flag.display: Overwrite output files if already present
Min Assembly Paths Length defined as GenomeMap (kb)
Min Coverage for Contig End Trimming
Min Coverage for Contig End Trimming

flag.description: Only merge contigs whose alignment Pvalue is below this threshold. Increasing stringency by lowering this T value will help avoiding chimeric merges (chimeric contigs). Decreasing stringency will increase chimeric contig rate.
